note.p: Birth: East Bergholt, Suffolk, England (02 June 1798)
Education: Jesus College, Cambridge. BA (1824), MA (1824)

Career: Ordained (1821); went to New South Wales as cleric in charge of an area from Paramatta to the Hawkesbury River; discovered fold (1841), tin (1849) and diamonds (!859); visited Tasmania (1856 and 1860); died of paralysis
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1878-1879 vol 28 pp i-iv
Notes: A letter from his son (MC.11.394) says that he died on 16 Jun at 1.30 am. DSB also gives date of death as 16 Jun.
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
